[GRAMMAR]: Repeated use of "a thing" and "the stuff" instead of specific terms.
[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing in "on a stuff of the thing" and "the stuff of the thing."
[LEXICON]: Illogical use of "the stuff speech of Babylon" and "a stuff" as placeholders.

[LOGIC]: Disjointed references to "a thing" and "the stuff" create confusion about key locations/objects.
[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transitions between archaeological details and administrative history.
[CLARITY]: Repetition of tablet descriptions without clear narrative progression.
[TRANSITION]: Sudden shifts between technical terminology and vague references.

Unclear phrase "in the thing" in "resistance of the powerful priests of Amon in the thing"
Overly complex sentence structure with multiple clauses about the king altering his throne-name

Unclear reference to "a stuff" in "A stuff apparently even tried to give himself out..."
Awkward sentence structure in "This Haya, who was entitled..."
Confusing use of "the stuff" in "An official named the stuff receives instruction..."

[LOGIC]: Sudden shifts between discussing the religious reform and specific officials without clear connections
Repeated use of undefined terms "a thing" and "the stuff" creating confusion
Jump between discussing the religious reform and its political implications without clear transitions
